title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4 ECD:Child Survival and Development (CSD) RELATED EMERGENCY INTERVENTIONS (0780/A0/06/881/004)

description.narrative: Children aged 0-5 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to health, nutrition and WASH services that are life-saving, facilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency., which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children under 5 in targeted areas benefit from improved access to quality healthcare and nutrition, protection and development opportunities in their home, care and preschool environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children aged 0-5 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to health, nutrition and WASHservices that are life-saving, facilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency.

description.narrative: UNICEF assisted over 250,000 children, women, men and healthcare workers to access urgent lifesaving treatment for COVID-19 and prevent the spread of the pandemic. UNICEF extended support to the Ministry of Health for Infection, Prevention and Control measures by upgrading isolation facilities and providing essential medical equipment to hospitals and field settings to ensure appropriate care for confirmed and suspected cases of COVID-19. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
